definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: The Constant Gardener is talky and intelligent, and never takes the cheap way out.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影有很多对白，充满智慧，而且从不俗气老套。

sentences.english: It is considered somewhat tacky, however, to pass out resumes at a party.
sentences.chinese: 但是，有点俗气的方法就是在聚会上派发简历。

sentences.english: With the children of Worldliness, your first wife, plead from a goodly distance.
sentences.chinese: 你第一位妻子俗气的孩子会为优美的遥远未来辩护。

sentences.english: Their lives seemed to me so petty, so slavish.
sentences.chinese: 他们的生活在我看来是那样卑微，那么俗气。

sentences.english: Chinese mind since then are stuffed with barbarian spirit of vulgarity and shamelessness .
sentences.chinese: 中国人的样子从当时候起就充溢了蛮横，俗气和无耻。

sentences.english: I mean, I was a raw foodist,  which now sounds terribly cliche again.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经是个生食主义者，现在听起来很俗气。

sentences.english: Every day, he swaggers through the street, dressed in cheap and vulgar finery.
sentences.chinese: 他每天穿着廉价而俗气的华丽衣服，招摇过市。

sentences.english: Vulgarity is a lowness that proclaims itself.
sentences.chinese: 俗气就是流露出来的一种下劣性。

sentences.english: We like to bait him about his gaudy ties.
sentences.chinese: 我们爱取笑他戴的俗气而华丽的领带。
他的举止看上去很俗气。

sentences.english: The disease of worldliness is like typhoid.
The Communist shoutings are not dhave, or gaudy advertising up.
sentences.chinese: 党的标语被换了下来，代之以俗气的宣传。

sentences.english: Rain erosion of you, but also help you to wipe the powder that on your face.
sentences.chinese: 天雨侵蚀了你，也帮你洗去了脸上俗气的抹粉。

sentences.english: Their minds are free from worldliness.
sentences.chinese: 他们的思想已经从俗气中解放出来。

sentences.english: She is one of the vulgar rich.

definition: to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
